definition: glory, splendor, wealth and rank (idiom); high position and great wealth
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua

sentences.english: Do I why the absence for give up the reputation credit and riches of doing the regal concubine as a maidservant.
sentences.chinese: 我何必爲一個婢女放棄做妃子的榮華富貴呢。

sentences.english: Well, Dingo didn't make me rich the day he walked into my home.
sentences.chinese: 狗來富，如果一條狗走進你家，你就會榮華富貴。

sentences.english: Because the villain thinks the nabobism, therefore obtains corruptly not tires.
sentences.chinese: 小人因爲想榮華富貴，所以貪得到無厭。

sentences.english: The vermilion gates and windows better highlight the wealth and rank of her family.
sentences.chinese: 朱漆的門窗更能突顯她家的榮華富貴。

sentences.english: By faith, Moses turned his back on prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 因著信心，摩西離棄了榮華富貴。

sentences.english: All the splendor 1 in the world is not worth a good friend .(Voltaire , French thinker)
sentences.chinese: 人世間所有的榮華富貴不如一個好朋友。

sentences.english: All the splendor in the world splendor in less than a good friend.
sentences.chinese: 人世間的一切榮華富貴不及一個好朋友。

sentences.english: It means that all the wealth in the world is nothing but a dream.
sentences.chinese: “南柯一夢”比喻世間榮華富貴不過是一場空夢。

sentences.english: All the splendor in the state is not worth a bad friend.
sentences.chinese: 人世間所有的榮華富貴不如一個好同學。

to abandon suffering and obtain happiness (Buddhism)

to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
